title: Activating Implicit Knowledge in Reading Comprehension Strategy Instruction: A Professional Development Program for Mathematics Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: Process where pre-service/in-service mathematics teachers reflect on teaching experiences to convert tacit knowledge into explicit pedagogical methods

learning_goals: Learners can identify and explain three or more reading comprehension strategies applicable in the context of mathematics instruction.
Learners can develop five or more specific teaching strategies from tacit knowledge by writing reflective journals based on their teaching experiences.
Learners can evaluate and improve their reading comprehension strategy instruction at a metacognitive level through peer feedback.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
